newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank lowered its mini-band on the real currency by buying dollars at 1.0700 and selling at 1.0750 reais per dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The previous mini-band was set on Monday at between 1.0690 and 1.0740 reais per dollar. Today's auction was the sixth time this month the bank has nudged the mini-band lower.
Today's result of the auction represents a 0.09 percent decline from the previous mini-band. So far this month, the Central Bank has shifted the mini-band 0.61 percent lower.
In the last few months, the Central Bank has lowered the mini-band between 0.57 percent and 0.63 percent each month.
